PyEngine moduleÔÉÅ

Game Engine for Python. Requires Pygame.

class PyEngine.GameButton(x: int = 0, y: int = 0, function=None, notHoverSprite: Surface = 'default', hover: bool = True, active: bool = True, hoverSprite: Surface = 'default', imageRes: int = 64, image: str = 'Defaults\\DEFAULTBUTTON.png', imageResX: int = 0, imageResY: int = 0, message: Message = None)ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Create a button that can trigger a function if clicked on or a message is recieved (if one is provided)

listen()ÔÉÅ

Listens for clicks on the button. Should be in a loop.

listenPulse()ÔÉÅ

Listens for hover once. Should NOT be used in a loop. Useful for controllers.

show(**kwargs)ÔÉÅ

Blit button to screen. Screen to blit to required. Requires defined image

class PyEngine.Message(name)ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Creates a message that can be sent and recieved

Bases: object

translate(x=0, y=0)ÔÉÅ
PyEngine.animation(moveList: list, fps: int, frames: int, screen, x, y)ÔÉÅ

Pygame animation.

PyEngine.checkHover(x1: int, x2: int, y1: int, y2: int, function)ÔÉÅ

Runs a function if mouse is in given area

PyEngine.listenAll()ÔÉÅ

Listen on all created buttons at once

PyEngine.listenPulseAll()ÔÉÅ

Listen pulse on all created buttons at once

PyEngine.load(saveFile: str) → dictÔÉÅ

Load a dictionary of variables from a json file and return it

PyEngine.loadMods(modDir: str, loadingScreen: Surface = None, screen: Surface = None)ÔÉÅ

Load mods in given directory. Returns list of loaded mods as Module objects. The folder containing each mod‚Äôs files must start with an uppercase letter and the .py file must be the same name but lowercase.

PyEngine.save(saveFile: str, save)ÔÉÅ

Save a dictionary of variables to a json file

class PyEngine.staticImage(x: int, y: int, image: str)ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Static Graphic that doesn‚Äôt move. Requires x,y and image

show(screen)ÔÉÅ
PyEngine.wasdInput(WFunction=None, AFunction=None, SFunction=None, DFunction=None)ÔÉÅ

Simple WASD/arrow keys input listener. Also supports arrow keys. Args are functions to run when respective key is pressed
